options.label: binary-task-model-plots1
options.fig.cap: pdf-CDF plots for the unit normal distribution. The red curve is the pdf and the blue line is the CDF. The dashed line is the reporting threshold $\zeta = 1$.

options.label: binary-task-model-shaded-tails
options.fig.cap: Illustrating that 95 percent of the total area under the unit normal pdf is contained in the range |Z| < 1.96, which can be used to construct a 95 percent confidence interval for an estimate of a suitably normalized statistic. The area in each shaded tail is 0.025.

options.label: binary-task-model-shaded-plots
options.fig.cap: The equal-variance binormal model for $\mu = 3$  and  $\zeta = 1$; the blue curve, centered at zero, is the pdf of non-diseased cases and the red one, centered at $\mu = 3$, is the pdf of diseased cases. The left edge of the blue shaded region represents the threshold $\zeta = 1$. The red shaded area including the common portion with the vertical red lines is sensitivity. The blue shaded area including the common portion with the vertical red lines is 1-specificity.

options.label: binary-task-model-rocs
options.fig.cap: ROC plots predicted by the equal variance binormal model for different values of mu. As mu increases the intersection of the curve with the negative diagonal moves closer to the ideal operating point, (0,1) at which sensitivity and specificity are both equal to unity.
